item.title: Designing Resilient APIs with Idempotency
item.description: How can we design APIs to be resilient when our networks necessarily aren’t? An API should be robust enough to handle failure scenarios including connectivity drops, timeouts between resultant calls, and more. If a client makes a request to our API and loses connection during the request, how can we ensure that a successive identical request doesn’t alter the state of the system in a way that we weren’t expecting? This is where idempotence comes into play.
